meanings.definition: A person who studies the anatomy of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Neuroanatomists carefully examine the nerves in the body to understand how they work.
meanings.sent2: The neuroanatomists at the university are conducting groundbreaking research on brain structures.
meanings.sent3: The neuroanatomists had a 'brainstorming' session to map out the nervous system.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the complex web of nerves like a skilled neuroanatomist unraveling a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The neuroanatomists' detailed diagrams made the nervous system come alive in textbooks.

meanings.definition: Those who specialize in the structure of the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: Neuroanatomists focus on understanding the intricate design of the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent2: The neuroanatomists' lab is filled with models of the brain and spinal cord for study.
meanings.sent3: The neuroanatomists joked that they had 'spinal cordial' discussions at work.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of the brain's pathways was so deep, he was like a neuroanatomist of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The neuroanatomists' expertise in brain structures was evident in their detailed presentations.
